page.title: 02Courteenhall Village
page.content: The village of 23 houses is situated to the east of Courteenhall House. Six houses were Council- built in 1951, the others of local stone were all thatched until modernisation took place in 1961, also the year when the sewage works was built. There is a sub-post office which is open 4 days a week, an Art Gallery, a 900 year old church, and an active Choral Society. The village is served by a travelling Butcher and Baker. The 23 children, mostly of school age, have to travel to the nearby villages of Roade or Collingtree for Primary Education.
